angle.headline: The Tasman Trap: Surviving Phase II Closures
angle.angle: The City just dropped the hammer: Tasman Drive is locked down from Jan 28 to Feb 13. If you usually drive down Tasman to get to the Green Lot, you're driving into a wall. We're mapping the survival routes for locals and visitors alike.
angle.topic: Super Bowl LX Phase II/III Road Closures & Tasman Drive Lockdown

specific_facts: Tasman Drive is fully closed to private vehicles from Convention Center to Great America Parkway (Jan 28 - Feb 13).
GPS apps (Waze/Google Maps) are currently showing the route as open, leading to massive turn-around jams.
The VTA Light Rail is the only vehicle allowed to cross the Tasman/Great America intersection.
Rideshare drop-off zones have been pushed back to Mission College Blvd (Mercado Center).
Lick Mill Blvd is the only viable east-west alternative for locals avoiding the highway.
Walking from Mercado Center via the Creek Trail takes ~18 minutes vs 45 minutes in traffic.

key_quotes_stats: "If you usually drive down Tasman to get to the Green Lot, you're driving into a wall."
"The map you used last year is worthless."
"Drivers are seeing 'Open' on their phones and 'Road Closed' on the barricades."
"The 'Tasman Trap' is adding an hour to commutes for anyone trusting their GPS."
counter_arguments_to_address: "I have a resident pass, I can get through." (Fact: Resident passes get you into neighborhoods, not through the hard closure zone on Tasman).
"I'll just get dropped off at the Hilton." (Fact: The Hilton is inside the hard perimeter; only guests with specific credentials can enter).
